item.title: Sources
item.description: GoTriangle documents sources of noise from the railyard operations maintenance facility (ROMF) in their October 2018 ‘noise and vibration technical report’. The 2018 report mentions the following ROMF noise sources: Wheel squeal ‘tight radius curves within the proposed ROMF have the potential to cause wheel squeal’ ‘SEL at 50 feet for LRT wheel squeal is assumed to be 136 dBA‘ Power substation ‘proposed substation within the ROMF is assumed to operate continuously’ ‘SEL at 50 feet of 99 dBA’ Tree removal ‘removal of up to 600 feet of intervening trees from the proposed ROMF site between Interstate 40 and sensitive receptors west of Farrington Road’ ‘assumed to increase existing highway noise from Interstate 40 by 10 dB’ Train movements ‘The schedule of LRT train movements within the ROMF is assumed to be as follows’: Daytime movements (7:00 AM to 10:00 PM): 32 total movements Nighttime movements (10:00 PM to 7:00 AM): 48 total movements The 2015 noise report assumes the ROMF will operate at ‘SEL at 50 feet’ of 111 dBA (Table 3, page 19).

item.title: Mitigation
item.description: The GoTriangle 2018 noise report describes ways to mitigate (reduce) the noise: ROMF buildings: 5 dB berms: 10 dBA train wheel treatments: 2 dBA train design changes: 5 dBA The GoTriangle 2015 noise report describes another way to mitigate wheel squeal, absent from the 2018 report. ‘Resilient/damped wheels are incorporated into project design to reduce wheel squeal noise 10-20 decibels.’ No written updates have followed the October 2018 noise report as of February 2018.

item.title: Assessment
item.description: GoTriangle estimated noise levels for areas near the railyard operations maintenance facility site based on long term noise monitoring sites nowhere near the ROMF site, west of I-40. Closest long-term noise monitoring sites closest to Creekside and west of I-40 were: 214 Celeste Circle, Chapel Hill (LT-4) 4315 Randall Road, Durham (LT-5) Annotated map of noise monitoring sites from noise report
